business.headline: Sensex falls over 700 points: Why is the stock market down today?The Sensex has slipped over 700 points to fall below 84,400, while the Nifty has tumbled below 25,800, led by losses in banking, metal, and IT stocks.
Sensex opens 350 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; Kotak Bank down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 400.82 points to 84,701.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 134.80 points to 25,825.75 as of 9:24 am.
Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market fall again?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,964.5 around 8:03 am, hinting that the Nifty 50 might open close to Monday's closing level of 25,960.55.

Meesho, Aequs IPO debut: Can these listings make you rich? GMP gives a hintMeesho and Aequs shares are set for their stock market debut on December 10. Both IPOs attracted robust investor attention during the bidding phase.

Trump greenlights Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China as US gets 25% cutDonlad Trump said that he had informed President Xi Jinping of China, where Nvidia's chips are under government scrutiny, about the move and he "responded positively," according to Trump's post.

Trump considers fresh tariffs on Indian rice as US farmers allege unfair dumpingThis comes after US farmers urged tougher action, arguing that subsidised rice imports are battering US markets and pushing domestic prices down. Donald Trump vowed to "take care" of the issue and pressed officials to identify countries accused of undercutting US markets.
Monopolies, duopolies and oligopolies: IndiGo's unique grip on global marketNo airline in any major market of the world dominates its home skies like IndiGo does.

Paramount's $108 billion hostile bid for Warner Bros amid Netflix's merger plansNetflix had appeared to clinch the deal on Friday after a weeks-long bidding battle with Paramount and Comcast, securing a $72 billion equity agreement for Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studio, and streaming businesses.
Will your home loan EMIs fall as HDFC, PNB, and 3 other banks cut lending rates?With several banks adjusting their lending rates downwards, home loan customers may soon notice a drop in their EMIs.

Credit negative: Moody's slams IndiGo for chaos, cites lapses in regulatory planningIndiGo's recent flight chaos has drawn sharp criticism from Moody's, which says the airline failed to prepare for regulatory changes despite having ample time.
Can betting everything on one stock destroy 9 out of 10 portfolios?Can a single stock, no matter how strong it looks, quietly wipe out years of your savings if the market turns? Have a look.

Sensex slides 600 points, Nifty slips below 26,000 as FII selling spooks Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex plunged 609.68 points to close at 85,102.69, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 225.90 points to settle at 25,960.55.

Is a Rs 10,000 SIP really enough to make you wealthy?A Rs 10,000 SIP has become the go-to number for new investors. It sounds practical and easy to maintain. But is it truly enough to build wealth, or is it just a starting point? Here's a simple look at what matters.

Why insurers reject claims and the smart ways to avoid itMany policyholders mistakenly believe claim rejections are arbitrary, but they primarily result from identifiable causes related to process gaps, compliance failures, and policy design.

Sensex tumbles over 700 points: Why is the stock market down today?Broader markets mirrored the weak sentiment, with mid-cap and small-cap stocks witnessing sharper cuts than frontline indices. Intraday volatility also spiked, signalling heightened nervousness on Dalal Street.

Wakefit IPO opens: GMP falls sharply, should you still apply?The Wakefit Innovations IPO opened on December 8 and will remain available for bidding until December 10. Shares are scheduled to list on both the BSE and the NSE, with a tentative listing date of December 15.

Why gold is beating equities this yearWhenever central banks grow cautious or stock markets begin reflecting fear, investors instinctively look for safe havens. That's exactly what has happened globally. The uncertainty has pushed investors out of risk assets and back into gold.

Will new income tax rules impose an 84% penalty on cash kept at home?As the government tightens its grip on cash transactions, a key question is now circulating: can unexplained cash kept at home invite an 84% tax penalty? Here's a simple look at what the rules actually say.

Wakefit Innovations IPO open for bidding: Check price band, bidding details, GMPWakefit IPO includes a fresh issue of 1.93 crore shares worth Rs 377.18 crore and an offer for sale of 4.68 crore shares worth Rs 911.71 crore

Meesho IPO allotment status: Follow these steps to check on KFin Tech, BSE and NSEInvestors who applied for Meesho's IPO can begin checking their allotment status, with high demand making allocation competitive. Once the allotment is finalised, investors will be able to check their status through three official platforms.

entertainment.headline: Will Dhurandhar mark Ranveer Singh's return as a box office frontrunner? After years of noise, misfires and stalled projects, Ranveer Singh needed a reset. Dhurandhar arrives as the first real spark of a shifting narrative.

Your body clock is telling you: Rhea Chakraborty opens up on egg freezing Rhea Chakraborty shared that she is considering egg freezing at 33, reflecting on the pressure women face while balancing biological timelines with career ambitions.

Malayalam director PT Kunju Muhammed accused of molestation, complaint filed A molestation case has been registered against Malayalam director and former MLA PT Kunju Muhammed for sexual misconduct during the IFFK screening. The complaint has reached Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and police are currently investigating the matter.

Vivek Agnihotri backs Dhurandhar team: Forget the naysayers, go celebrate Vivek Agnihotri shared a post on X and praised Aditya Dhar and Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar. The filmmaker wrote about how tough it is to make films that challenge the ecosystem.

Women in Cinema Collective declares support for survivor after Dileep acquittal Women in Cinema Collective (WCC) reaffirmed solidarity with the survivor following the Kerala court's decision in a high-profile Malayalam film industry assault case. Actor Dileep was acquitted in the actor assault case while six others were convicted.

Mohit Chauhan falls on stage during Bhopal concert, band members rush to help him Singer Mohit Chauhan's concert at AIIMS Bhopal saw a tense moment when he tripped and fell on stage during his Nadaan Parinde performance, prompting an immediate medical check. The event resumed after organisers ensured his safety, while videos of the incident went viral with fans expressing concern.

Dhurandhar box office Day 4: Ranveer's film beats Ram-Leela's lifetime collection Ranveer Singh's latest action drama, Dhurandhar, achieved a major box-office milestone in just four days, overtaking the lifetime earnings of his earlier film, Goliyon Ki Rasleela Ram-Leela. Industry reactions highlight the film's strong performance and audience response.

Krithi Shetty breaks down over online abuse: My mother pulls me out when I'm low Actor Krithi Shetty described the impact of online hate on her mental well-being, sharing personal experiences of trolling and the crucial role her family plays in her recovery.

Sharmila Tagore's 81st birthday: Saif, Soha and Sara Ali Khan celebrate in Delhi Veteran actor Sharmila Tagore marked her 81st birthday on December 8 with an intimate family gathering in Delhi, joined by her children Soha Ali Khan, Saif Ali Khan, and granddaughter Sara Ali Khan.

Rajinikanth recalls Aishwarya Rai's rejection, Jayalalithaa's Padayappa screening Rajinikanth shared insights on casting decisions for Neelambari in Padayappa and describes the circumstances leading to a special screening for Jayalalithaa after rumours circulated about the character's inspiration.

Akshaye Khanna's viral Dhurandhar dance was fully spontaneous: Actor Danish Pandor Akshaye Khanna's viral entry scene in Dhurandhar has captured the internet, with Danish Pandor sharing that the actor's crowd-pleasing dance was completely improvised. The moment has amplified the film's growing buzz, adding to the praise for its performances and stylish execution.

Like Latin Grammys, Indian music should have its own category: Raja Kumari American singer-songwriter, Raja Kumari, speaks to IndiaToday.in about her Grammy-nominated album, Sounds of Kumbha, commissioned by the Uttar Pradesh government as a tribute to the Mahakumbh Mela. She also opens up about the growing global influence of Indian artists and musicians.

Priyanka Chopra shares adorable artwork gifted by daughter Malti: Mama holding me Priyanka Chopra Jonas shared an emotional moment after daughter Malti Marie gifted her a sweet hand-drawn sketch of the two of them, symbolising their loving bond.

Sydney Sweeney addresses plastic surgery rumours, says changes are natural Sydney Sweeney has publicly shut down long-running plastic surgery rumours, clarifying that she has "never gotten work done" and is "terrified of needles." The actor also urged critics to stop comparing her childhood photos to her present-day appearance, calling social media scrutiny "insane."

Kelsea Ballerini calls out fan for mentioning ex-husband during Sydney concert Kelsea Ballerini shut down a disruptive fan during her Sydney concert after they shouted support for her ex-husband Morgan Evans, urging audiences to keep her shows respectful. The singer later addressed the incident online, reminding fans that "Penthouse" is a personal song that shouldn't be used for negativity.

Rajinikanth confirms Padayappa sequel Neelambari Padayappa 2 ahead of 75th birthday Celebrating the re-release of 'Padayappa' on its 25th anniversary, Rajinikanth confirmed a sequel, 'Neelambari: Padayappa 2', promising an exciting return for Ramya Krishnan's iconic character. The actor recalled the film's unmatched craze: women once "breaking gates" to watch the original 1999 blockbuster.

Rahul Bose faces fraud charges for forging Himachal domicile to be rugby body chief The controversy began in 2023 after Rahul Bose pledged to the royal family of Shimla that he would help establish and recognise a state-level rugby association. The plans did not materialise.

Selena Gomez joins Taylor Swift at Chief's Game to support Travis Kelce Pop icons Taylor Swift and Selena Gomez, seen supporting Travis Kelce at the Chiefs game, reaffirmed their friendship after Swift attended Gomez's wedding. This marked Swift's fifth game since her engagement, thrilling fans who captured blurred stadium photos of the supportive duo.

From Dhurandhar to Mahakali: Akshaye Khanna's next chapter Akshaye Khanna's recent portrayal in 'Dhurandhar' has drawn attention to his subtle yet impactful approach to acting, reinforcing his reputation for conveying depth with minimal dialogue. India Today delves into his new chapter as the actor will next be seen Prasanth Varma's 'Mahakali'.

general news.headline: IndiGo faces action over cancellation chaos, to lose 5% flying routesIndiGo, in its latest update on the severe disruptions, said Monday night that it had refunded Rs 827 crore for cancellations up to December 15. The airline also reported a 90 per cent on-time performance across its network and said it operated more than 1,800 flights despite over 450 cancellations during the day.

Trump considers fresh tariffs on Indian rice as US farmers allege unfair dumpingThis comes after US farmers urged tougher action, arguing that subsidised rice imports are battering US markets and pushing domestic prices down. Donald Trump vowed to "take care" of the issue and pressed officials to identify countries accused of undercutting US markets.

After decades, Pakistan to be divided again; more harm than good, say expertsAfter decades of political hesitation, the long-debated proposal of administrative restructuring of Pakistan is back on the table. Pakistani minister Abdul Aleem Khan has said that carving out smaller provinces is now inevitable. However, experts say that the proposal could do more harm than good.

'New science?' Arvind Kejriwal mocks Rekha Gupta over 'AQI is temperature' gaffeDelhi's air pollution debate heats up as Chief Minister Rekha Gupta defends water sprinklers at monitoring sites. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal accuses the government of hiding true pollution levels.

Akshaye Khanna's viral Dhurandhar dance was fully spontaneous: Actor Danish PandorAkshaye Khanna's viral entry scene in Dhurandhar has captured the internet, with Danish Pandor sharing that the actor's crowd-pleasing dance was completely improvised. The moment has amplified the film's growing buzz, adding to the praise for its performances and stylish execution.

Live: Rahul Gandhi to kick off discussion on electoral reforms in Lok Sabha todayParliament Winter Session Live Updates: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi will kick off a discussion on election reforms in the Lok Sabha today. The opposition has been seeking a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls since Parliament's Monsoon Session, but the Centre suggested a broader debate on election reforms, noting that the Election Commission is an independent constitutional body. The discussion will continue for two days. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

India shouldn't be in delusion...: Asim Munir in 1st address as tri-services chiefIn his first address after becoming Pakistan's inaugural Chief of Defence Forces (CDF), Field Marshal Asim Munir warned India once again, asserting that any future act of aggression would be met with an even more "swift, severe, and intense" response from Islamabad.

Starlink says India site glitch showed fake pricesStarlink has clarified that the pricing briefly visible on its India website was only dummy test data caused by a glitch, and the company will reveal real plans only after securing final government approvals.

Fake doctors on call on Blinkit? Experts flag 30-second antibiotic prescriptionBlinkit's doctor-call service has raised multiple questions about accountability, mostly blurring the line between accessibility and safety. Doctors have warned strongly against the practice as it only worsens India's antibiotic resistance crisis.

This time for Assam? Himanta Sarma now eyes a Shakira concert in GuwahatiFollowing the success of the Post Malone concert, the Assam Chief Minister expressed optimism about attracting more such international stars to Guwahati to boost the state's concert economy.

Sensex falls over 700 points: Why is the stock market down today?The Sensex has slipped over 700 points to fall below 84,400, while the Nifty has tumbled below 25,800, led by losses in banking, metal, and IT stocks.

Chinese man detained in J&K over travel violation; he searched Article 370 on phoneA Chinese tourist was detained in Kashmir after entering Ladakh and Jammu and Kashmir without permission, triggering security alerts. Authorities found his phone searches linked to CRPF deployments and Article 370, leading to further investigations.

Gurugram man smokes inside theatre during Dhurandhar screening, thrown out by securityIn the viral video, the man seated in the front row can be seen smoking a cigarette in the middle of a packed theatre during the screening of Dhurandhar.

Goa club owners fled to Phuket via IndiGo flight after fire killed 25: PoliceGoa Police is coordinating with the Interpol division of the CBI to apprehend Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra at the earliest. Both accused took IndiGo flight 6E 1073 to Phuket at 5:30 am on December 7, barely five hours after the deadly incident that claimed 25 lives.

IPL 2026: 350 players finalised for auction, Quinton de Kock makes surprise entryThe BCCI has unveiled the full list of players finalised for the IPL 2026 auction scheduled to be held in Abu Dhabi on December 16. 240 Indians and 110 overseas players will go under the hammer during the bidding event.

IndiGo pilot's emotional apology to passengers on flight amid crisis goes viralAmid the nationwide IndiGo cancellations and delays, a pilot issued an emotional apology, which has received appreciation and emphasised the need for kindness towards airline staff.

Why this tiny Punjab village is known as India's hockey villageSansarpur, a small Punjab village, has produced over 300 hockey players including 14 Olympians. Despite decline, local efforts aim to revive its historic hockey culture and inspire future generations.

Exclusive: Mastermind, shooters behind attacks on Kap's Cafe identifiedKap's Cafe, which opened in Surrey, British Columbia, came under attack on July 10 just days after its launch. Two more shootings followed -- one on August 7 and another on October 16. The Lawrence Bishnoi gang claimed responsibility for the attacks.

Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt, wife arrested in Rs 30 crore fraud caseThe alleged Rs 30 crore fraud targeted Indira IVF founder Dr Ajay Murdia and was reportedly carried out under the pretext of producing a biopic on his late wife. The police have named Vikram Bhatt as the main accused in the case.

We can't run airline...: What Supreme Court said on urgent hearing of IndiGo crisisThe issue was mentioned by a lawyer who told the Bench that passengers were suffering as flights were being cancelled without any prior intimation.

1st T20I: Coach Gambhir back to his comfort zone as India begin World Cup pushIND vs SA 1st T20I preview: Coach Gautam Gambhir returns to his favourite hunting ground as reigning world champions India begin their official march towards the home T20 World Cup with the opening match of a five-game series against South Africa.

Man carrying gun tries to enter actor Vijay's rally in Puducherry, detainedA man carrying a gun was stopped before entering Vijay's TVK public meeting in Puducherry on December 9. He was identified as a guard of a party district secretary. The event followed strict police restrictions.

Mohit Chauhan falls on stage during Bhopal concert, band members rush to help himSinger Mohit Chauhan's concert at AIIMS Bhopal saw a tense moment when he tripped and fell on stage during his Nadaan Parinde performance, prompting an immediate medical check. The event resumed after organisers ensured his safety, while videos of the incident went viral with fans expressing concern.

Magnitude 7.5 quake in Japan injures 23 and triggers tsunami; videos show impactA tsunami warning was issued for northeastern Japan after a 7.6 magnitude earthquake off the coast. Viral videos showed shaking chandeliers and vehicles shaking.

Will Dhurandhar mark Ranveer Singh's return as a box office frontrunner?After years of noise, misfires and stalled projects, Ranveer Singh needed a reset. Dhurandhar arrives as the first real spark of a shifting narrative.

Your body clock is telling you: Rhea Chakraborty opens up on egg freezingRhea Chakraborty shared that she is considering egg freezing at 33, reflecting on the pressure women face while balancing biological timelines with career ambitions.

sports.headline: Hardik, Axar on cusp of historic landmarks as India eye T20I series win vs South Africa India and South Africa are set to clash in a five-match T20I series, starting December 9 in Cuttack. After losing the Test series, India bounced back to win the ODI series and will now aim to carry that momentum into the T20Is.

IPL 2026: 350 players finalised for auction, Quinton de Kock makes surprise entry The BCCI has unveiled the full list of players finalised for the IPL 2026 auction scheduled to be held in Abu Dhabi on December 16. 240 Indians and 110 overseas players will go under the hammer during the bidding event.

Josh Hazlewood ruled out of Ashes, Pat Cummins set to return for Adelaide Test Australia fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of the entire Ashes series due to an Achilles injury. However, captain Pat Cummins is set to return for the third Test, bolstering Australia's pace attack as they hope to secure an unassailable 3-0 series lead.

Rohit Sharma helped me feel comfortable, play freely in early career: Shardul Thakur Shardul Thakur said Rohit Sharma helped him play freely during his early years. The Mumbai Indians all-rounder credited Rohit's support for shaping his confidence and comfort as he prepares for a homecoming season in IPL 2026.

Has Salah already played his last Liverpool game? Arne Slot has no clue Arne Slot's admission that he has "no clue" about Mohamed Salah's future deepened Liverpool's ongoing uncertainty. The fallout from Salah's interview has left the club navigating one of its most delicate moments of the season.

IND vs SA 1st T20I, Cuttack weather report: Will rain play spoilsport? IND vs SA: India will face South Africa in a five-match T20I series starting December 9 at Barabati Stadium. There are slight chances of rain ahead of the first T20I in Cuttack.

Can Suryakumar Yadav rediscover his best form with T20 World Cup looming large? IND vs SA: Suryakumar Yadav hasn't had the best of years in T20Is, but has a chance to regain his form in India's five-match T20I series against South Africa, starting December 9 in Guwahati.

1st T20I: Coach Gambhir back to his comfort zone as India begin World Cup push IND vs SA 1st T20I preview: Coach Gautam Gambhir returns to his favourite hunting ground as reigning world champions India begin their official march towards the home T20 World Cup with the opening match of a five-game series against South Africa.

Smriti Mandhana's latest Instagram post goes viral: Calm isn't silence Smriti Mandhana's latest Instagram post has set the internet ablaze with fans implying that there is more to the caption than what meets the eye.

Ex-World No.4 turns down 270000-dollar offer from betting company in bold move Former World No.4 Caroline Garcia turned down a 270,000 dollars betting sponsorship for her podcast, prioritising athlete welfare and integrity over money.

Salah dropped from Liverpool's Champions League squad vs Inter after public outburst Mohamed Salah has been left out of Liverpool's squad for their Champions League match against Inter Milan following his public criticism of the club and manager Arne Slot. The Egyptian forward, set to participate in the Africa Cup of Nations with Egypt later this month, was not named among the 19 players travelling to Italy, raising questions about his future at Anfield.

Hardik Pandya opts out of training, Gill returns with intense two-hour net sessionIND vs SA, 1st T20I: Hardik Pandya skipped India's training session as a precaution ahead of the T20I opener, while Shubman Gill returned with a long, intense batting stint in Cuttack.

Shreyas Iyer's next scan in December, rehab plan to follow after specialist reviewAll eyes are on Shreyas Iyer's mid-December scan, which will decide when he can begin rehab at the COE and take his first real step back towards competitive cricket.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma having to prove themselves is laughable: R AshwinFormer India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has slammed the critics questioning Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, insisting the iconic duo have nothing left to prove at this stage of their careers.

SMAT 2025: Sai Sudharsan back in T20 mode after poor Test form, hits 100 in AhmedabadSMAT 2025: After a poor run of form in Test cricket, Sai Sudharsan found his mojo in the shorter format, slamming a hundred for Tamil Nadu in Ahmedabad.

SMAT: After KKR retention, Ajinkya Rahane makes strong statement with unbeaten 95Ajinkya Rahane sent a strong reminder of his value to KKR with an unbeaten 95 that powered Mumbai to a nine-wicket win over Odisha and secured their top spot in Elite Group A of the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy.

Brendon McCullum echoes Ben Stokes' weak men remark: England can't have a glass jawEngland head coach Brendon McCullum has urged his team to stay tough and fully committed as they face a must-win situation in the Ashes after going 0–2 down in Australia.

How South Africa plan to counter in-form Abhishek Sharma in T20I series vs IndiaSouth Africa T20I captain Aiden Markram put a premium on Abhishek Sharma's wicket, saying the new-age Indian opener embodies the fearless and ultra-aggressive style of play that has reshaped the format.

IND vs SA 1st T20I Predicted XIs: Sanju Samson vs Jitesh Sharma in wicketkeeper raceIND vs SA 1st T20I Predicted XIs: Selection intrigue peaks in Cuttack as India weigh their options for the wicketkeeper with the Samson–Jitesh duel, Gill's return and Nortje's comeback shaping a gripping start to the T20I series.

Relieved by Ro-Ko absence, South Africa ready with fresh plans for India: MarkramIND vs SA, 1st T20I: South Africa captain Aiden Markram admitted he is relieved by the absence of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, but maintained that India remain a formidable force in the shortest format.

Mitchell Marsh giving up Test return hopes? Australia star makes big career decisionAustralia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh will retire from Sheffield Shield cricket at the end of the 2025–26 season, putting his future in Test cricket in serious doubt.

Gautam Gambhir advised to stop picking fights after jibe at Parth JindalAakash Chopra has urged Gautam Gambhir to moderate his tone following a fiery press conference after India's ODI series win against South Africa. The advice comes amid Gambhir's criticism of media and Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal.

1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav continues to be captain cool at pressersIND vs SA, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav once again lived up to his "captain cool" persona as he fielded questions with trademark composure on the eve of the first T20I against South Africa. Asked about India's unusual new approach at the toss and the team's recent streak of losses, Suryakumar dismissed any fuss around the method, saying he was more than happy to follow KL Rahul's lead for the series. "I'll do it with my left hand as well," he smiled.

Chess: R Praggnanandhaa qualifies for 2026 Candidates after winning FIDE CircuitIndia's chess prodigy has gone on to win the FIDE Circuit 2025 tournament, securing his position in the upcoming edition of the Candidates tournament, set to begin in 2026.

IND vs SA T20I series Live Streaming: Squads, schedule and all you need to knowIND vs SA: India and South Africa will kick off a five-match T20I series on December 9 in Cuttack, with the first match at Barabati Stadium and the final one in Ahmedabad on December 19.

Despite 2-1 triumph, India penalised in ODI series against South AfricaIND vs SA: India were fined for a slow over-rate in the second ODI in Raipur, but still showcased impressive batting and bowling to secure the series against South Africa.

Hardik Pandya's return unlocks new combinations, balance for India: Suryakumar YadavIND vs SA T20Is: With the five-match T20I series against South Africa set to begin, India's preparation for the 2026 T20 World Cup is informed by recent stability in team selection and the return of key all-rounder Hardik Pandya, as confirmed by captain Suryakumar Yadav.

Smriti Mandhana back in nets after saying wedding is off, brother shares photoSmriti Mandhana returned to training at what appears to be a private facility. The India cricketer's brother shared a photo of her practising, accompanied by a heart emoji, a day after her wedding was officially called off.

Ricky Ponting hits out at Jofra Archer for fiery Steve Smith exchange at GabbaAshes, Australia vs England Gabba Test: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting did not hold back as he publicly slammed Jofra Archer for trying to sledge Steve Smith in the closing stages of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba in Brisbane.

IND vs SA: Suryakumar Yadav keeps mum on Rinku Singh's snub ahead of 1st T20IIndia T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav chose not to comment on Rinku Singh's omission ahead of the South Africa series. Rinku has been dropped from the team ahead of the five-match series and is playing in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy for Uttar Pradesh.

Shubman Gill vs Sanju Samson as T20I opener? Surya explains big selection callIndia vs South Africa, Cuttack T20I: Captain Suryakumar Yadav justified India's decision to hand the opening spot to Shubman Gill in place of Sanju Samson. The skipper added that Samson remains in contention, alongside Jitesh Sharma, for the wicketkeeper-batter's role in the build-up to the T20 World Cup 2026.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
